posts.post_content:
@Lollercoaster

posts.post_content:
Hmm, not bad, but strictly worse tha**|--GETS SHOT IN HEAD--**  
  
The artwork *is* sort of a mess, as much as I love it... I guess if you're going to get annihilated by a 15/15 beast, spending your last moments wondering "what *is* that gigantic thing? Is that part of it its head? ...or its...?" isn't too bad a way to go. (I think murdershot21 gets it right -- the Flying Spaghetti Monster makes its CCG debut here...)  
  
Note that Emrakul the *creature* has Protection From Colored Spells. Emrakul the spell does not have that protection. Emrakul the spell can't be countered, true, but it can be targeted by other spells and abilities.  
  
So, for example, you could use [Venser, Shaper Savant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, Shaper Savant) to return Emrakul-the-spell to its owner's hand (for that matter Venser can also target Emrakul the creature because the comes-into-play ability isn't a spell, it's a triggered ability). Hmm. There might be some horribly convoluted way for a player to play Venser on thei... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
wow that is depressing I got first comment and it was deleted along with every other comment I did for Eldrazi cards. But the important thing is has anyone noticed its name can be shortened to EAT? cause it eats games I guess  
  
@tabqwerty  
  
You know that protection from colored spells, doesn't actually do anything when its a creature card in a deck? You also know that [Polymorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polymorph) doesn't:  
  
**D**eal damage to EAT  
**E**nchant EAT  
**B**lock EAT  
**T**arget EAT  
  
It doesn't do any of that when it flips cards and puts Emrakul into play, you can't cast [Polymorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polymorph) on Emrakul, but the effect can put him into play.  
  
Lastly, you know a bunch of people play a deck like this right? I dunno how many people could get break the rules...

posts.post_content:
Here's a weird thought.  
  
*When Emrakul is put into a graveyard from anywhere, its owner shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.*  
  
It does not specifically state that Emrakul goes with it.  
  
SO apparently, other than exiling it, one way to make sure this damn thing stays dead is to stick it in the graveyard of someone other than its owner.

posts.post_content:
Emrakul has protection from colored **spells**, not colors, so there are any number of ways to neutralize this, or steal it from your opponent, or kill it.  
  
[Seasinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seasinger), [Captivating Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captivating Vampire), [Cytoplast Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cytoplast Manipulator), [Empress Galina](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empress Galina), [Helm of Possession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helm of Possession), [Infernal Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infernal Denizen), [Keiga, the Tide Star](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keiga, the Tide Star), [Memnarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnarch), [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker), [Rubinia Soulsinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rubinia Soulsinger) or her cousin [Merieke Ri Berit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merieke Ri Berit), [Willow Satyr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Willow Satyr), [Crown of Empires](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crown of Empires), [Trip Noose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trip Noose), [Icy Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Icy Manipulator), [Royal Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Royal Assassin), [Amber Prison](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amber Prison), [Tsabo Tavoc](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tsabo Tavoc), [Aphetto Grifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aphetto Grifter), [Attrition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Attrition), [Diversionary Tactics](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diversionary Tactics), [Elder Druid/aut](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elder Druid/aut)... Posted By: dark_hero (1/17/2011 11:07:55 PM)
Rating:

Turn 1
- Swamp -> -> Dark Ritual -> ;
- with Entomb Emrakul; Emrakul's triggered ability which forces you to shuffle your graveyard into your library triggers and goes on the stack;
- with cast Shallow Grave; It goes on top of the stack, above the triggered ability;
- Shallow Grave resolves, and Emrakul enters the battlefield with haste;
- Emrakul's triggered ability resolves, and you shuffle your (empty) graveyard into your library;
- ATTACK!!!

posts.post_content:
@ Trep.the.Treehugger  
  
*Emrakull + Venser, the Sojourner's +2 ability. Infinite turns. Pretty overkill since you're probably already winning simply by having a big 15\15 flying annihilator creature, but fun for the whole family. Except maybe for those who are losing...*  
  
No. Venser's ability exiles him, then brings him back. Emrakul's "take an extra turn" occurs when you CAST him, not when he comes into the battlefield. As you did not cast him when he returns, you do not get an extra turn.
posts.html:
@ Trep.the.Treehugger

Emrakull + Venser, the Sojourner's +2 ability. Infinite turns. Pretty overkill since you're probably already winning simply by having a big 15\15 flying annihilator creature, but fun for the whole family. Except maybe for those who are losing...

No. Venser's ability exiles him, then brings him back. Emrakul's "take an extra turn" occurs when you CAST him, not when he comes into the battlefield. As you did not cast him when he returns, you do not get an extra turn.

Posted By: Lord_Seth_02 (8/13/2012 8:50:13 PM)

posts.post_content:
The impossibly awesome game of awesomeness:  
  
Starting hand:  
3 utopia sprawl/wild growth  
1 arbor elf  
1 forest  
2 Instill energy  
  
Draw Lightning Greaves  
  
Play forest and Arbor elf on turn 1  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Turn 2  
  
Draw another Instill energy  
  
Tap forest, enchant it with utopia sprawl/wild growth  
Untap forest with Arbor Elf  
Tap forest and apply instill energy on arbor elf.  
untap/tap Arbor elf as needed Applying the rest of the instill energy's and utopia sprawl's/wild growth's to the forest and arbor elf.  
  
Cast Lightning Greaves and attach to Arbor Elf  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Turn 3  
  
Draw Emrakul, the Aeons Torn  
  
Tap forest 5 times total (20 mana)  
  
Hardcast Emrakul, the Aeons Torn on turn 3 with haste/shroud and 5 mana to spare. GG.  
  
Hey.... a man can dream, right?
